citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau
U.S. Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS), National Geodetic Survey (NGS)
citeinfo.title: United States 112th Congressional Districts, 2022

descript.abstract: U.S. 117th Congressional Districts represents the political boundaries for the United States 117th congressional districts. The official membership is current as of June 1, 2022. The 117th Congress is seated from January 2021 to January 2023.
descript.purpose: U.S. 117th Congressional Districts provides the congressional district boundaries and the district representatives for the United States, primarily for national planning applications. The boundaries are consistent with the state, county, and Census block group and tract datasets.

theme.themekey: polygon, congressional districts, Congress, House of Representatives, Democrat, Republican, area, boundaries, society

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States– Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, contact Esri by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing +1-888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at +1-909-792-0960; or visit https://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded. Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States– Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by email, telephone, or fax or write to us.

dataqual.logic: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The spatial accuracy varies with the source materials used. The U.S. Census Bureau cannot specify the spatial accuracy of features changed or added by field staff or through local updates, features derived from the GBF/DIME Files (TIGER’s predecessor in 1970 and 1980), or other map or digital sources. The positional accuracy is unknown.

citeinfo.title: House Bill 1029 / SL 2019-249
citeinfo.othercit: Downloaded the Shapefile under Show All Associated Documents.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Downloaded Census TIGER/Line Geodatabases 2020 from the U.S. Census Bureau and extracted the congressional districts dataset. Clipped to the shoreline using Census TIGER/Line Hydrography Geodatabases 2020 and NOAA National Shoreline datasets. Projected the dataset to World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS84). Added the fields DISTRICTID, STFIPS, and CDFIPS and created their values from parsing the values of the FIPS source field. Added the fields STATE_ABBR and STATE_NAME from Census TIGER/Line Geodatabases 2020. Added the fields NAME, LAST_NAME, and PARTY and copied their values from the Clerk of the U.S. House of Representatives document. Added the field SQMI and calculated its values projected to North America Albers Equal Area Conic. Updated the district boundaries for North Carolina. Reordered, renamed, and removed fields.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the congressional districts within the United States. Congressional Districts are the 435 areas from which people are elected to the United States House of Representatives. After the apportionment of congressional seats among the states based on decennial census population counts, each state with multiple seats is responsible for establishing congressional districts for the purpose of electing representatives. Each congressional district is to be as equal in population to all other congressional districts in a state as practicable. The boundaries may be changed more than once during a decade. For the District of Columbia, a separate code is used to identify the entire area of this state-equivalent entity as having a single nonvoting delegate.
enttyp.enttypds: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The congressional district identifier (four-digit number). It combines the state code with the congressional district code to create a unique identifier.
